page.title: 19Old Buildings in Gringley
page.content: {The Manor House}was built in grounds of C15th manor;original well is below present stable;original nesting boxes in old dovecote;owners - McGrath. {The Homestead}original C16th foundations lie below present kitchen which was built in C17th.;parts rebuilt & extended c.1750;extended again c.1780 & dovecote built of which upper part in original condition;roof water collects in underground tank & pump by kitchen door draws it up for garden use;to right of pump is fresh water well 30ft deep;owners - Thomson. {Appleton Farm}buildings date from C19th to 1907;vaulted cellars;Worksop Priory pew in entrance hall;window from Wiseton Hall facing Appleton Field;dovecote in barn > 700 nesting holes & boxes;water supply piped from springs on farm until present owners Mr&Mrs Round modernised early 1980's.
